greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A077118(n) - n^3.
comment: Values d=x^3-y^2 of extremal points of elliptic Mordell curves. Definition extremal points see A200656. Each value x have only one value of distance d when coordinate x is extremal point, but for many fixed distances d elliptic curve have more than 1 extremal point. - _Artur Jasiński_, Nov 30 2011
Theorem (*Artur Jasinski*): If a(n)>0 then a(n)<(4n^(3/2)-1)/4 for every n. If a(n)<0 then a(n)>(-4n^(3/2)-1)/4 for every n. a(n)=0 then n is perfect square. - _Artur Jasiński_, Dec 08 2011
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 29 2002
